column1: good length, straight, defended solidly back down the pitch
loops over midwicket! Short of a length, de Kock looks to whip it away, spoons off the splice but lands safe after the fielding at midwicket had moved in with the bowler
big full toss! Nearly driven back to the bowler, took de Kock by surprise, pushes it straight down the pitch
short of a length, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
good length outside off, driven towards the bowler who sticks his right boot out...crashes into the non-striker's stumps
fuller, wide outside off, he's through his drive without any timing and finds cover
short of a length on leg stump, takes the thigh pad as he looks to whip it away
on the pads, back of a length, swung to long leg
short of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to cover
fuller, outside off, driven square to deep cover
back of a length outside leg, worked into midwicket and that's a very tight single...probably gone with a direct hit from Binny
flash and a miss outside off, an appeal for caught behind from the bowler but has no support. Was short, Rohit went after it with a back-foot drive
over the wicket, full at leg stump, driven to long-on
gets the line a little wrong, angled in at leg stump, Rohit sweeps it wide of short fine leg

straight back to the bowler! Bit of an odd dismissal, really. Rohit used his feet, didn't quite get to the pitch, pushed with hard hands, it was a googly, got an inside edge into his pad which looped back to Gopal
short of a length, straight, pushed to long-on off the back foot
nicely bowled, good length outside off, perhaps a touch quicker, chopped down in front of slip as he attempts to angle it to third man
dropped at long-on! Archer sprinting in off the rope, dives forward, but can't hold on. De Kock aiming to go over the top, sliced across the ball and couldn't get the distance
smashed down the ground, full outside off, thumps through the line and sends it straight back past the bowler
that's very well played, comes down the pitch and gives himself room outside leg them square drives a back-of-a-length delivery through cover
three in a row! He's toying with the bowler a little, Kulkarni straightens his line, but it's on the hip and gets pulled backward of square
into the crowd! De Kock is cutting loose. Short again, this time he doesn't even try to keep it down and lofts the pull over deep square leg
back of a length, straight, worked towards straight midwicket
touch of width outside off, square drives and finds cover
over the wicket, short outside off and it scuttles under the bottom edge of a cut shot through to the keeper
that's brisk and painful! Short of a length, de Kock looks to whip across the line and is taken high between the legs
full, width outside off, 128kph, driven to cover
length ball at off stump, swung away through midwicket with a cross-batted swipe, deep square is able to get around
terrific shot, de Kock picks a slightly slower one - 124kph - it's full outside off, drives over the off side
another blow for de Kock! Almost in the same spot. Short of a length, the ball squats a little on him as he aims to pull
over the wicket, back of a length, takes the pad into the off side
follows him as he moves a little to leg, good length at middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
good length at off stump, defended to the on side
short of a length, tight on off stump, forced into midwicket
poor delivery, way down the leg side, Yadav walks inside the line and allows it through
wrong line again, full outside leg, clips the pad and beats the diving keeper, runs away to fine leg
tapped away to keep the strike
short outside off, clubbed to mid-on
back of a length and skiddy, punched to long-on
goes round the wicket to de Kock and angles it into the pads, tucked away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back and whips towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, gets on the front foot to drive to long-off
back of a length offcutter outside off, gets back and across to whip to midwicket
oh my. That's a slower short ball, dug into the pitch, and de Kock is through the pull waaay before the ball arrives. Bounces loopily and it's on its way down when it passes over the bails
fuller, on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
goes wide of the crease and bowls a shortish offcutter angling in towards off stump. Pulled away to the right of long-on
short of a length again, this time angling into middle stump. Stops on the batsman a little and he waits for it to arrive and punches to long-on
shortish, down the leg side, poor ball to bowl with fine leg inside the circle. De Kock swivels and swats it away to the left of the diving fielder
length ball outside off, driven to extra-cover
a touch slower on off stump, and he errs on the full side. Right in the slot for Suryakumar to loft back over the bowler's head
slower length ball on off and middle, driven gently down to long-off
Round the wicket, angles this in towards middle and leg. Clears the front hip and swipes it down to long-on
back of a length on middle stump, whipped to wide long-on
slower length ball on middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way and whips it to deep square leg
over the wicket, short of a length, heaved to deep midwicket
short again, clubbed to midwicket without proper timing on this occasion
this is a clubbing shot through straight midwicket, a back-of-a-length ball goes wide of long-on
over the wicket, back of a length at middle and off, pushed into midwicket with a straight bat
a very short slower ball, loops through to the keeper as he lets it go and gets the wide call
swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery and doesn't make contact
a superb piece of invention to take him to fifty, scoops a short delivery down to fine leg, just helped it around the corner...a 34-ball half-century
good length, straight, eased down to long-on
touch short outside off, doesn't bounce much, de Kock keeps low on the shot and pulls to deep midwicket
whipped off the pads to deep midwicket
goes back in the crease and takes this from outside off to deep midwicket
full at off stump, whips through a square cut which finds backward point
a little shorter, he plays back and lofts it straight down the ground neatly between long-on and long-off
a fresh-air shot as he swings to the leg side against a short-of-a-length delivery outside off
back of a length, clubbed through the line down to long-on where Stokes is very swift
tries something here, sweeping a back-of-a-length ball which is adventurous...gets a top edge into his body. And then gets whacked on the back by the throw for good measure
that's a beauty! Sounded very sweet off the bat and went miles back over deep midwicket. Was in the arc, good length at the stumps, and it was a lovely swing of the bat
a slower ball, at the stumps, nudged into midwicket...has a decent chance for a hundred
risky line, short on the hip, but it's only a single as he flicks to long leg...Royals won't mind him keeping the strike
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
is he stumped? Beaten outside off by a shorter, flatter delivery. Think he's managed to push the foot back across the line, he's done well there
very short outside off, another googly, lack of pace off the pitch helps the bowler as de Kock only sends it to long-off
it's a wrong 'un again, whipped in the air, one bounce to deep midwicket
very full outside off, shapes for the slog-sweep but it goes quite straight towards long-on
low full toss, straight, driven to long-off
short, wide slower ball, takes ages to reach the batsman, by which time he's already played a futile air-slash
slower ball again, fuller this time, again in that fifth-stump corridor. Goes for the big slog and misses
loopy slower ball, fuller this time, full enough for Suryakumar to swing through the line and hit it back down the ground, over the non-striker's head and to the left of long-on
back-of-a-length slowie this time, pulled from outside off, in the air, but bounces well short of the fielder, to the right of long-on

there's the answer. Dhawal Kulkarni's on the fine leg boundary, and he runs to his right and takes a simple one after Suryakumar miscues a hook off a Binny bouncer that gets up over his right shoulder
shortish, angling across to off stump, pulled down the ground to long-on
tossed up, floated across towards off stump, and he gets down low to sweep to the left of long leg, where Binny makes an excellent sprinting, diving save at the boundary
flatter now, slanted across to off stump, makes room to cut but can't beat backward point

wrong'un, short one, pitching on off stump and spinning further away. Looks to fetch a pull from a long way outside off stump and only manages to slice it high in the air and into the waiting hands of the long-on fielder
lovely. Quick legbreak just outside off, with just enough air on it to draw Pandya forward. Looks to defend but it dips and turns and zips past his outside edge
back of a length, at Pandya's left hip, whipped away to long leg
full flighted ball on middle stump, defended inside-out to short extra-cover
back of a length outside off, looks to open his bat face and guide it to third man but doesn't get it to slide off his bat with too much pace. Backward point moves to his left and stops it
fullish outside off, looks to drive towards mid-off and short extra-cover moves to his right to intercept
full slower one, angling in towards off stump, shows the full face to drive to long-on
in the blockhole on off stump, jams his bat down and squeezes it out to midwicket

full, angling in towards off stump, pushes to the left of cover and takes off, and there's a direct hit at the striker's end... Looks like Hardik's just made it, nice stretch at the end. Rahane with the throw from cover

excellent finish to an excellent over. Sharp bouncer, angling in from wide of the crease, homing in on Hardik's helmet. Keeps his eye on the ball and sways out of the way. A less quick bowler may have given him time to attempt a ramp, but not so in Archer's case
full, angling across towards off stump, punched to the left of long-off
back of a length slower one, aiming to tuck Pollard up. Worked quietly off the hip through backward square leg

dropped. Archer puts down his second of the match. It seemed to be in the slot for the big hit from Hardik, full and angling across towards off stump. Clears his front leg and goes for it, but it's the slower cutter and he doesn't quite time it. Archer comes in off the deep midwicket boundary, slides forward and gets his hands under the ball, but can't hold on
back of a length on off stump, clears his front leg and hoicks it away, effortlessly, over the midwicket boundary

got him, huge wicket. Another slower cutter, aiming at middle stump. Pollard gets on the front foot for another big hit, plays slightly across it - looking to go over midwicket rather than long-on - and ends up playing early, creating a big gap for the ball to barge through

what a shot that is! Slower ball, back of a length, fifth-stump line, and you'd think there's very little pace for Cutting to work with, but he lets it come on, and just dabs it away to the left of backward point, and somehow sends it speeding away over the outfield even as the fielder gives chase
shot. Strays onto the pads, and Hardik likes the opportunity to use his wrists, whips it away up and over short fine leg, and deep backward square leg has little chance running to his right
length ball on off stump, driven to long-off
fast, effortless off-stump yorker. Jabbed back to the bowler
slower ball, back of a length, fourth-stump line. Stops on the pitch and Cutting is through his punch early. Wants to play it through the covers, plays it back to the bowler in the end
stump-high full-toss on off stump. Was looking for the yorker but missed his length. Still a hard ball to deal with at Archer's pace, and all Cutting can do is jab it back to the bowler

now the slower short ball, considerably slower than the previous ball, outside off. Swings too early through his pull and fails to make contact. Concedes just five off the over despite starting it with a boundary
looks for the wide yorker, ends up slanting it way too wide. Hardik leaves it alone - not much else he could have done
slower ball, back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Flat-batted to the left of long-off, no real power on it
wide and full, and Hardik throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge on it. Third man is up in the circle and the ball flies between that fielder and the diving Samson behind the stumps
again he goes for that wide line, and ends up slanting the ball too wide. Attempted slower one this time

ARCHER DROPS ANOTHER! Slower short ball just outside off, and Pandya miscues his front-foot pull. Archer again comes in from the midwicket boundary and dives forward. Again he gets both his hands to it, and again he fails to grab on

poor Unadkat. Slower length ball pitching on the stumps and spinning away from them. Super shot from Pandya, brings down a straight bat and scoops the ball back over the bowler's head, gets it to carry all the way
in the blockhole on off stump, jams his bat down to dig it out to extra-cover

another slower ball, nipping away towards off stump. Cutting clears his front leg and looks to hit over the leg side. Miscues, slices off the outside half of the bat, but it lands well short of the fielder coming in off the long-on boundary

well, we have a review for lbw first ball! Yorker, and Pandya plays all around it, looking to flick it away. Given not out, and Smith reviews without too much hesitation. Hits him on the front boot... Impact in line with middle and leg, and ball-tracking says it'll crash into leg stump. Bye bye, Hardik
back of a length, straightens a little in the corridor close to off stump. Lets it come on and drops it into the cover point region for a quick single
in the blockhole on off stump, low full-toss but low enough to count as a yorker. Stabbed down to long-off
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and carves it away to deep point
shortish, wide of off. Grips on the pitch and nips away a little like a legcutter. Slashes hard and is beaten by the movement and lack of pace

length ball angling into off stump, and finally Cutting gets one right in his zone. Clears his front leg and absolutely wallops this over the forward square leg boundary. Mighty hit to end the innings, and it takes Mumbai past 160 on a slow, tricky pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
a fraction fuller, outside off, Rahane makes a small press forward and defends to point
shorter, outside off, gets onto his toes and drives off the back foot to deep point
short of a length at off stump, a bit of a hack across the line but it's very effective as he sends it to deep midwicket
that's a very clever shot, a touch wider outside off, short of a length, angles it fine of short third man
beats the edge this one, just a little shape away, playing away from his body looking for another glide to third man but wasn't in as much control
round the wicket, full and straight, pushed to long-on
floated up at leg stump, Samson gives himself a touch of room, allows him to free his arms, lofts it straight down the ground
gets forward and flicks a good-length ball to deep midwicket
fired in as a low full toss, clipped to the leg side
wonderful shot! That's so classy...takes a step outside leg stump then drives inside-out over extra cover. Could watch that all day
that's just as good! He's looking a million dollars at the moment. Stays still this time, drives with a slightly open face and threads the gap through the covers, wide of long-off. Such timing.
full at the stumps, defended to the bowler

short of a length, big appeal for lbw from Malinga as Rahane whips across the line and Rohit calls the review with a few seconds to spare. Looked high to start with and it looks even higher on the replay, and he's almost off the ground as he plays it. Poor review. Going miles over the stumps
oops! A lovely slower ball, defeats Samson's attempt to angle it away, reaches de Kock on the second bounce and he can't take it. Bonus runs
short of a length, another slower one, grips a touch on the surface, played to midwicket
opens the face to a short-of-a-length delivery, 137kph, and scampers the run to short third man
angled into the pads, glanced backward of square
short of a length outside off, cuts firmly and bisects the men at short third man and backward point
back-to-back boundaries as he goes down and sweeps firmly off a good length, straighter delivery, sends it in the air to deep backward square
better length, at the stumps, defended
caught at cover! Chahar hits back. Full at off stump, just held in the pitch enough, Rahane came forward and couldn't keep his push down
short on the pads, whipped to deep square leg
that's another lovely shot, just started to move to leg but then didn't go, Chahar bowled at leg stump and Samson went down to paddle it very fine
back of a length at off stump, thickish inside edge to the leg side
short of a length, angled in at off stump, defended on the back foot
this is fuller, at off stump, pushed into the covers
a short delivery, he sits on the back foot and waits, then angles down to third man
goes deep in the crease, tucks a straight delivery into midwicket and placed nicely for the second
short of a length, shapes in to middle and off, defended to the on side
back of a length outside off, a cutter, holds in the pitch and is pushed uncertainly back to the bowler
short outside off, has to wait a long time for this at 117kph, pushes into the covers
strong shot! Some width outside off, he powers through the line and slices it through backward point to third man
fuller, at the pads, flicked to deep square
what a shot! That's the best of Smith. Back of a length outside off, driven sweetly square of the wicket through point
gets across to off stump, the bottom hand takes over as he plays a bottom-handed whip to deep square
full at off stump, driven to point
oh, what a stroke! Uses his feet and plays a wonderful whip over the leg side, goes all the way over wide long-on...jeepers, that was a good shot
taps a good-length delivery to the off side
worked off the pads to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, goes back and a cross then works down to long-on
stand and deliver! Stays in his crease, frees his arms through a full delivery outside off, lofts it over cover/wide long-off
short of a length, straight, worked to square leg

caught at long-on! It was all looking so good for Samson. Well bowled by Chahar, was brave enough to give it some air, Samson tried to launch it straight, sliced across the shot and provided Pollard a simple catch
full and straight, defended coming forward
very short, played off the back foot to long-off
short of a length, skids through and keeps low, Stokes has to quickly get the bat down

dragged on! A gamechanging over? Not the best of shots from Stokes, looking to cut this from tight on off stump, gets a bottom edge into the stumps. But was another lovely piece of bowling. Gripped and spun back into Stokes to further cramp the shot
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives to cover
that's a long hop outside off, pulled powerfully through straight midwicket
fuller, at the stumps, whipped down the ground
pushes a shorter delivery to midwicket
dragged down short, swift footwork gets himself in good position and he pulls well wide of deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, Smith a little squared up as he defends to cover
well bowled! Full at middle and off, gets a leading edge towards point as Smith plays across the line
worked to deep midwicket
rocks back and drives a shortish delivery to deep cover, good placement
lovely delivery! Sharp spin from this leg-break, he ends up square-on to the bowler
taps a short-of-a-length delivery to the leg side
flat length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit slower, angled into leg stump this time, and he quickly opens up and gets down on his back knee to slog-sweep to the left of deep midwicket
ooh, flatter, and he misreads the length. Goes back, playing the trajectory and looking to pull from around off stump. Skids on and hurries him into a short-arm jab to long-on
back of a length on off stump, swatted away to the left of deep midwicket
fuller now, on leg stump, driven to long-on
quickish length ball with a bit of in-drift towards middle stump, nudged into the vacant midwicket region and the bowler has to sprint there to mop up

back of a length outside off, rocks deep in his crease and pulls to the right of long-on. Pollard fields and fires a direct hit at the striker's end, but there's no one around to back up and they sneak an overthrow
back of a length outside off, goes back again to flat-bat to mid-off
again goes deep in his crease to a shortish delivery outside off, plays a flat-bat swat down the ground to long-on

back of a length, goes wide of the crease and angles this slower ball in towards off stump. Shuffles across, looking to work it leg side, but it takes an age getting to him and he can only jab it back towards the bowler
shortish, again goes wide of the crease to angle it in. Not as short as Smith would like, and he inside-edges the pull into his back thigh pad

and again, angles it in from wide of the crease. This time he sits leg-side of the ball and looks to slap it through point, but the ball stops on him and he hits it into the covers without much power at all
length ball angling into off stump, shuffles across to work it through square leg

big shout for lbw, but is there an inside edge? Rohit Sharma thinks so, so there's no review. Smartly bowled by Bumrah - he knows Parag has been sitting deep in his crease, looking to set himself up for the pull. The attempted yorker, angling in from wide of the crease, ends up as a full-toss that hits him on the pad, but there's a tickle of inside edge along the way while he tries to flick it away
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, goes back and across to pull and misses, the ball rolls away into the point region off back pad
and again, a big shuffle across from Smith to try and work it from outside off. Only manages an inside edge into his pad
in the blockhole on off stump, whipped away through midwicket
full, angling in towards off stump, manages to place the drive past the right hand of short extra-cover, but doesn't get enough power on it to beat mid-off moving to his left
back of a length outside off, the offcutter. Looks to shuffle across and whip it through square leg, gets beaten on the inside edge
in the blockhole, angling down leg. Looks to get his front pad away from the line and flick, but can't make contact. Rolls off the boot into the backward point region. Was there an inside edge? Maybe
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Looks to make room but the angle cramps him, and he ends up flat-batting it back to the bowler. Wanted to hit it through cover

shot. The pressure was mounting on Parag, and he finds a way to the boundary. Pandya was getting a little predictable with his length and angle in from wide of the crease, and Parag just jumped across his stumps and used that angle to scoop the ball over short fine leg

third man is also inside the circle, and this time Parag moves away towards the leg side,, looking to make himself room. Opens his bat face to try and steer it from middle stump past backward point, ends up getting a thick outside edge that flies away to the left of short third man
back of a length again, jumps across to work it through square leg

he's been hurrying the batsmen all along, and he bowls a flat one on that in-between length, on off stump, and gets it to turn towards off stump. Looks to flick and nearly pops back a return catch off the leading edge
bam! Just marginally short, and he rocks back and hammers it high over wide long-on
length ball on leg stump, gets on the front foot to clip it into the square leg region

flat length ball on off stump, gets deep in his crease and pushes with a straight bat into the vacant short midwicket region. Chahar does well to chase it down in his follow-through, and makes Smith stretch to complete the quick single
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, worked away to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, gets on the back foot to play a straight-bat push into the midwicket region
length ball wide of off stump, Parag plays a wristy drive out to deep cover point
shortish outside off, uses his wrists to play a bottom-handed pull-whip to deep midwicket
that's a Malinga special. A dipping yorker that swerves away late in its trajectory. Parag looks to open his bat face and squeeze it past point, but the late swing beats his edge
misses the yorker length and ends up bowling a half-volley outside off. Parag clatters it away with a bottom-handed drive over extra-cover
bouncer in the fourth-stump channel, and Parag brings that bottom hand into play again, plays a tennis-style swat into the gap to the left of deep midwicket

back of a length close to off stump, and that's sensational timing from Smith. Stays a little leg-side of the ball, and meets it with an open face and sends it racing away to the right of third man. Not too much distance for the fielder to cover, but it just blazed past him
full, on the pads, clipped to long leg
bouncer, rising head-high and angling in from wide of the crease. Steps across to hook, and he's beaten for pace. Off the badge of the helmet, and it pops up and drops down into the long leg region
looks for the off-stump yorker, ends up bowling a low full-toss. Smith jabs it to short cover with a straight bat

full outside off, angling in from wide of the crease. Smith leans forward, looking for the cover drive. Plays a little early and the angle causes the ball to run away through midwicket off the inside half of the bat. That shot brings up his fifty
shortish close to off stump, no real room to free his arms for the pull, hits it to square leg without a great deal of power
slower length ball angling into the stumps from wide of the crease, whipped away to deep midwicket
slower offcutter outside off, quite short. Skids through a little low and sneaks under the attempted pull
nicely bowled. Saw Smith trying to make himself room and bowls a wide slower ball, quite full. Reaches out to flat-bat it, but can't put any power on it. Hits it straight to short cover

length ball angling into off stump, clipped away to the left of deep midwicket, and is that a run-out at the bowler's end? They risk a second run against Ben Cutting's rocket arm, and even though it isn't a direct hit, the throw is so flat and accurate, straight into Pandya's hands near the stumps, that Parag is at least six inches short
that's a pressure-relieving boundary. Short, just a bit of width, and Smith leans back and cracks a square-cut past the left hand of the diving backward point fielder
full outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover

make that 0, 0, 0, 0. Bumrah's deadly inward angle and skiddiness does in another batsman. Turner's front leg moves half-forward and across the stumps, and he ends up playing around his front pad looking to work it into the leg side. The angle beats his inside edge, and it's the plumblest of lbw decisions thereafter
shortish, angling into the front hip, tucked away into the square leg region

back of a length, angling into off stump. Smith pushes to the right of backward point and sets off for a quick single. Not too far from the fielder, Pollard, and he throws with his right arm... Direct hit at the non-striker's end, but Smith is home, just about
length ball angling in towards middle stump. Stays leg side of the ball and pushes to the left of short cover
length ball angling in towards off stump, Smith pushes gently to mid-off, who's right on the edge of the circle
back of a length outside off, looks to slap it through the covers, the angle makes him hit it towards mid-off off the inside half of the bat. Pollard's too deep again to prevent the single

full-toss angling down leg. It's the attempted yorker, it's dipping late, and Binny doesn't really know much about it, but he plays a blind flick at it, and gets a little tickle on it - or not - onto his pad, and the ball runs away to the fine leg boundary to bring up victory
